newsitem.title: UK: UK financial watchdog investigates press leak.
newsitem.headline: UK financial watchdog investigates press leak.

text.p: Britain's Personal Investment Authority (PIA) said on Tuesday its is investigating a leak of confidential information to the press.

The PIA said it has appointed Brian Cubbon, formerly permanent secretary at the Home Office, to establish how a confidential PIA board paper relating to a review of the pensions industry was disclosed.

The October 30 edition of the Independent newspaper carried a story on the review into the mis-selling of pensions, saying that Prudential, the country's biggest personal pensions provider, was dragging its feet on the investigation.
The paper said that Prudential topped a PIA list of the worst offenders, having completed only 10 assessments of over 41,000 pension review cases.
At the time, Prudential strenously denied the charge that it was dragging its feet.
The report will be compiled for the chairman of the PIA, Joe Palmer and will then "be made available to the relevant authorities."
